tpk::TclClock

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A Clock that reads the system clock using the Tcl API.

The TclClock is an implementation of Clock that reads the system clock which is a assumed to be some fixed number of seconds offset from TAI.

Public Member Functions

 TclClock (const double &offset=0.0) throw ()

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

tpk::TclClock::TclClock ( const double &  offset = 0.0  )  throw ()

Constructor with offset.

The offset parameter defines the time difference between the system clock and TAI (in the sense TAI - clock). For a clock running on UTC the offset is currently (January 2004) 32s and increases by 1s every time UTC undergoes a leap second. For a clock synchronized with GPS time the offset is a fixed 19s.

Parameters:
offset  offset between system clock and TAI (seconds).

Member Function Documentation

double tpk::TclClock::read ( void   )  throw () [virtual]

Read system clock.

Reads the system clock and returns the current TAI as a Modified Julian Date.

Returns:
TAI (MJD)
